value.title: 5 tips for Power BI Paginated reports
value.excerpt: Get 5 tips for Power BI Paginated reports from Paginated report bear, Chris Finlan and Patrick! These 5 tips can help you on your journey with Power BI Paginated reports.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba

value.title: A better way to share Personal Bookmarks in Power BI
value.excerpt: A while back Adam shared how you can share a personal bookmark with others. There is now a better way to share personal bookmarks in Power BI if your report is in a workspace. Learn how!  Share Power BI reports and dashboards with coworkers and others https://learn.microsoft.com/power-bi/collaborate-share/service-share-dashboards

value.title: Answering your datamart questions
value.excerpt: You've got a LOT of questions about datamarts in Power BI! Adam answers a few that we've seen popping up. Giving his thoughts on these questions.  Introduction to datamarts https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/transform-model/datamarts/datamarts-overview  Comparing dataflows to datamarts https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/transform-model/datamarts/datamarts-overview#comparing-dataflows-to-datamarts

value.title: Are you following best practices with Azure Synapse Analytics?
value.excerpt: How do you know if you are following best practices for Azure Synapse Analytics? One way is to check out this report that Patrick walks through. It's a great way to get an understanding where your database is at!  Azure Synapse Analyzer Report to monitor and improve Azure Synapse SQL Dedicated Pool performance

value.title: Are you thinking about your tooltips in Power BI?
value.excerpt: The base tooltips in Power BI are fine. But are you overusing them? Adding everything to them in your visuals? Adam gives you some things to think about with your tooltips!  Create tooltips based on report pages https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/desktop-tooltips?tabs=powerbi-desktop

value.title: Azure Active Directory and Power BI
value.excerpt: I take a look at how Power BI and Azure Active Directory interact.  Really it is more about Azure Active Directory and how do you get users into AAD.  This came up as I get pinged a lot from folks wondering how they can use AAD with Power BI, not necessarily realizing that it is already there.  http://blogs.technet.com/b/powerbisupport/archive/2015/09/15/azure-active-directory-and-power-bi.aspx

value.title: Brand your Report Server
value.excerpt: I break down how to make a branding package for SQL Server Reporting Services 2016. I compare it from the original skin, to the multicolor brand package that Chris Finlan put together, to my custom brand package for Guy in a Cube.  Branding the web portal - https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/mt710551.aspx

value.title: Demystifying Custom Partitions in Power BI

Patrick takes the mystery away and walks you through how you can create them.  Partitions in tabular models https://docs.microsoft.com/analysis-services/tabular-models/partitions-ssas-tabular

value.title: How the Power BI Data Region is selected
value.excerpt: In this video, I look at how the Power BI data region is selected. This is the what you see when you go to About Power BI and see "Your data is stored in". You should take care to make sure this is where the majority of users you are before anyone signs up for Office 365, Power BI or other Microsoft

value.excerpt: In this video, I look at how to install and configure the May 2017 Preview of Power BI Report Server. Power BI Report Server has a new standalone install experience and this product allows for Power BI reports to be rendered in the web portal along with paginated reports.  This will get you started with

value.title: Introducing Power BI Premium Per User (Preview)
value.excerpt: Are you curious what Power BI Premium Per User is all about? Adam walks you through how to get it and what it means from a user experience.
